Title: Pogba in race against time as Ligue 1 season looms
Summary: Paul Pogba's return to Monaco this summer set tongues wagging as the 2018 World Cup winner made his comeback to football . The midfielder is in a race against time as Ligue 1 season looms .

Title: Nigeria’s cultural ambassador, Palmer makes history in Philippines
Summary: Palmer Emmanuel Michael has made history as the first Nigerian to be crowned 'Great Man of the Universe – Culture and Arts Ambassador, at the prestigious international competition held in the Philippines .

Title: Lagos moves to regulate rents, curb abuse, with new Tenancy Bill
Summary: Lagos State House of Assembly has proposed a new law aimed at fostering harmonious relations between landlords and tenants . The law would clearly define rent payment structures, including yearly and monthly options and procedures for issuing eviction notices .

Title: Outrage over Ibom Air incident as IG orders KWAM 1’s probe
Summary: What began as a confrontation on an Ibom Air flight has exploded into a national row over human rights, privacy and due process, drawing in lawyers, regulators, civil society groups and the public . Ms Comfort Emmanson was banned for life after the incident .

Title: Dangote Refinery cuts petrol ex-depot price to N820
Summary: Dangote Petroleum Refinery has announced a N30 reduction in the ex-depot (gantry) price of the Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), popularly known as petrol, from N850 to N820 per litre, effective August 12, 2025 .

Title: FIRS partners Customs to drive National Single Window project
Summary: Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) and Nigeria Customs Service (NCS) stepped up collaboration on the National Single Window (NSW) project . The NSE is a landmark trade facilitation initiative expected to transform Nigeria's import and export processes .

Title: Financial Inclusion: CBN fair promotes alternative payment channels, others
Summary: CBN counselled members of the banking public at its maiden financial services fair . •Pledges availability of clean naira notes . CBN also gave practical tips on fraud prevention .

Title: NSDC seals deal with 4 new operators to produce 400,000 MT of sugar annually
Summary: The National Sugar Development Council (NSDC) has signed agreements with four operators to develop greenfield sugar projects that will collectively produce 400,000 tonnes annually . This is the latest phase in an ambitious campaign to slash the country’s hefty sugar import bill .

Title: Nigeria’s oil output rises to 1.559m bpd, highest in 2025
Summary: Nigeria’s oil output, excluding condensate, rose by 11 per cent, year-on-year, YoY to 1.559 million barrels per day, bpd in July . Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries, OPEC disclosed this yesterday in its August production announcement . Dangote Refinery reduces gantry price

Title: Ibom Air fracas: Comfort begins life at Kirikiri; NBA wades in
Summary: The authorities acted with lightning speed, but the same urgency is absent when dealing with the influential and politically connected . “In Ms Bob’s case, the authorities acted . speed,” the NBA wades in .

Title: One dies in Osun road crash
Summary: Osun State Police has confirmed the death of one Usman Mohammed in a road accident that occurred in Ikirun on Tuesday . The state Police Public Relations Officer, Abiodun Ojelabi, explained that the accident occurred around Oja Oba, a market located along the ever-busy Iree-Ila Road

Title: Court stops Ogun gov from demolishing Daniel’s house, hotels
Summary: Ogun State High Court issues ex-parte order barring Governor Dapo Abiodun or any official from the state government from tampering or demolishing the Asoludero Court, Sagamu GRA private residence of Gbenga Daniel . The order also covers the Conference Hotels Limited and the annex also owned by the

Title: Insecurity: Zamfara lawmakers knock gov, seek FG's intervention
Summary: Zamfara State House of Assembly has again expressed dissatisfaction over Governor Dauda Lawal’s security arrangements . The House has called on the Federal Government to coordinate the security operation in the state in order to save lives and properties of the people of the state .

Title: How rising union fees are crushing our livelihoods – Okada riders
Summary: Motorcycle riders in the Obafemi-Owode Local Government Area of Ogun State have raised the alarm over alleged extortion and frequent harassment by fee collectors . The riders, who operate in Magboro, Mowe, Arepo, and neighbouring communities, appealed to the state government to intervene . They claim they are being forced to

Title: Lagos begins two-day traffic diversion in Ikoyi Friday
Summary: The Lagos State Government has released a plan to divert traffic around Osborne Road in Ikoyi, Eti-Osa Local Government for two days, specifically Friday, August 15 to Sunday, August 17 .
